author: Keith Harp

changelog.release_notes: Version 1.5 handles different shape and size pebble watch faces better.  This is largely in prep for the Pebble Time 2, but also makes it look much better on the Pebble Round.

Version 1.4 adds the ability to choose OpenWeatherMap or Yahoo for the weather source.  Note that this was driven by Yahoo stopping working for me.   I did leave the code for Yahoo intact since it had worked well for so long and if is a temporary glitch, then it might work again.
Version 1.3 adds a workaround for a pebble firmware bug.  The bug causes communication to lock up sometimes after bluetooth disconnect/reconnect.  The workaround restarts the app if the error occurs.

Version 1.2

  Add user options to turn on second hand for a defined period or until tapped again by tapping.
  Pay attention to bluetooth status to avoid pinging for weather if not connected to save battery
  Move Sync indicator to bluetooth location so that weather/temp can stay on screen during sync.
Release 1.1 adds the ability to turn off weather updates during a range of hours, to save battery life.

This is an updated version of the Minimal Analog watchface published by Reliant Web Solutions, LLC.   His website for settings no longer worked, and he asked for someone to pick up the development.
This version adds support for Phone based settings (Clay), as well as color selection, and a larger font for the temperature.

description:
A simple analog watchface that includes 
    - weather (Yahoo or OpenWeather), 
    - bluetooth disconnect notification (optional)
    - seconds hand (always on, always off, or able to toggle with a tap)
    - low battery indicator
    - configurable colors
    - two looks for the hands (hollow rectangle or solid pointer)

This is based on code originally by Reliant Web Solutions.
Unfortunately, he was unable to keep working on it, and the settings page was no longer reachable.  He generously shared his code, and this is the result, with the settings now available on the phone using the Clay tool.
